intro: Stelis deuteowerneri, commonly known as the Deutewern's orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is a small epiphytic plant, typically found growing on trees in humid, tropical environments. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
